title.narrative: HTD INTENSIVE CATTLE FATTENING AND CAPACITY BUILDING

description.narrative: The project concerns the intensive fattening of 400 cattle per year. It consists of buying lean animals to put them to fattening. The operation will concern male or non-male cattle aged 2 to 5 years. Lean animals will be supplied from cattle markets in the region, particularly those of Aagjert, Oum Lahyadh and Termessa respectively in the Moughataa of Aioun and that of Kobeni. The operation will preferably focus on moorish zebus.

description.narrative: Sector: solar, Location: Acharim, Tagant region, Description: COGER plans to address the communitys lack of energy access by installing a 20-kilowatt solar-powered mini-grid and distribution network. COGER will sign an agreement with the community to pay for the electricity via a local guarantee. The local community will elect a management committee to help oversee the system. COGER will train the management committee as well as numerous local technical agents and collections agents on operations and maintenance as well as payment collection. The installation of the solar mini-grid will allow the population of Acharim and surrounding towns to have a source of energy to increase their productive capacity and income generating activities, including grocery stores, cold rooms, and wheat milling.

title.narrative: Waly Fish Farming Capacity Building Project

description.narrative: This project is a response to the decline of fishery resources and the problem of unemployment among young people and women in the region. The challenges of the project are multiple: (i) develop a large profitable fish farm in the area; (ii) contribute to the harmonious development of aquaculture in Mauritania; (iii) make up for the decline in sea fishing catches in Mauritania and the shortage of products fisheries in several regions; (iv) contribute to food security by making quality products available to consumers very good quality; (v) reduce youth and female unemployment in the region; (vi) participate in the training of stakeholders in aquaculture; (viii) develop a competitive and environmentally friendly private sector; (ix) label fish products Waly aqua for export.

The Cooperative will set deepen two current wells and dig a new well to provide a reliable and constant source of water to the production perimeter. These activities will enable Cooperative members to dramatically increase the volume of vegetables sold and the profit earned by group members. Members will also benefit from improved equipment for their womens center for sewing and embroidery activities.,
